conclusion: Analyzing the flow path of liquids from containers A, B, C, D to determine whether they'll end up in container E or F.
At the top of the board, there are colored containers labeled A, B, C, D.
At the bottom, there are collection containers labeled E and F.
In between, there are various colored baffles (angled bars) that will redirect the flow of liquid.
The liquids appear to be colored to match their containers.
Starting from container A (light green at the top).
The liquid from container A flows downward and hits the light green baffle.
The light green baffle is angled and redirects the flow toward the gray baffle.
The liquid continues along this path, getting redirected by each baffle it encounters.
The liquid from container A appears to flow toward the left side of the board.
Starting from container B (pink at the top).
The liquid from container B flows down and eventually reaches the yellow baffle.
The pink liquid combines with other colors on the yellow baffle.
The flow from container B continues downward along a path created by the baffles.
Starting from container C (orange at the top).
The liquid from container C flows directly down to the yellow baffle.
The liquid from container C merges with other colors and continues along the path dictated by the angled baffles.
Starting from container D (green at the top).
The liquid from container D flows down and interacts with multiple baffles.
The green liquid appears to flow toward the right side.
The liquids from containers B and C clearly flow onto the yellow baffle.
The liquid from the yellow baffle appears to continue toward the red baffle.
From the red baffle, the flow continues toward the left side (container E).
